meanings.definition: Having a stronger hold or grasp
meanings.sent1: The new gloves are grippier than the old ones.
meanings.sent2: The rock climber needed grippier shoes to climb the steep cliff.
meanings.sent3: Trying to hold onto the slippery soap with grippier hands was a challenge.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was grippier than any adhesive, never letting go of her dreams.
meanings.sent5: The memory of her grandmother's warm hug was grippier than any sorrow.

meanings.sent1: The new tires are grippier on wet roads.
meanings.sent2: The grippier surface of the road reduced accidents during the rain.
meanings.sent3: The cat found the grippier carpet amusing, trying to slide on purpose.
meanings.sent4: His words were grippier than glue, sticking in her mind long after he left.
meanings.sent5: The idea of helping others was grippier than any selfish desire.

meanings.definition: More likely to cause discomfort or pain when held or touched
meanings.sent1: The thorny bush was grippier than it appeared, causing scratches.
meanings.sent2: The grippier fabric of the couch irritated her sensitive skin.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten found the grippier toy hilarious, attacking it relentlessly.
meanings.sent4: His words were grippier than a slap, leaving a lasting sting in her heart.
meanings.sent5: The fear of failure was grippier than any physical pain she had experienced.
